summary.para: Represents an encapsulated response from a command handler.

remarks.para: Strictly speaking, a command should never return a value, however this response type allows for the scalar return of a command outcome, for example the rows affected for a database update or the identifier for a newly created data record.
The design of this response intentionally restricts the type of value that can be returned to structs like int and Guid. For more complex objects, the standard Query / Query response should be used.
Beware of using this approach with distributed commands. They really have to be true fire-and-forget operations.
